duties_responsibilities.duty: Coordinate outreach activities to provide access and increased visibility of programs to underrepresented prospective students.
Advise students regarding programs, specializations, and the process of transferring to CWU.
Represent the college at career fairs, college transfer fairs, education fairs, and tabling events.
Present to potential groups of students at community colleges and organizations to recruit students interested in programs.
Provide individual and group advising to help students plan their transfer to CWU.
Assess student plans, advise on course selection, and advocate on their behalf with colleges and programs.
Prepare and conduct program-specific and general college orientation, workshops, and campus tours.
Analyze and interpret student data for department and university reports.
Serve on the CEPS Marketing and Recruitment committee and contribute to the development and dissemination of marketing materials and e-recruitment activities.
Develop and implement comprehensive recruitment programs and marketing strategies to increase enrollment and awareness of program offerings to diverse student populations.
Maintain relationships with community and technical colleges, distribute marketing materials, and analyze target markets for effective recruitment materials.
Build and sustain relationships between educational institutions, corporate, community, and governmental organizations or associations.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Education, Counseling, or related field (Master’s preferred)
